pr_title: Add support for other Firebase products to integrate with Remote Config.

timeline.bodyText: Can we rename this function or alias it for personalization
timeline.author: ashwinraghav
timeline.diffHunk:

               firebaseApp,
               firebaseInstanceId,
               isAbtSupported(firebaseApp, namespace) ? firebaseAbt : null,
+              isAbtSupported(firebaseApp, namespace) ? firebasePersonalization : null,

timeline.bodyText: Is the plan here for RC to fail hard if this component is unavailable. If this is an optional dep, then this should be optional
timeline.author: ashwinraghav

replies.bodyText: Removed the separate PersonalizationComponent and just put everything into RC itself.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.bodyText: It is not clear why the personalization SDK needs to know anything at this stage. That seems like an optimization
timeline.author: ashwinraghav

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I guess it is. Removed.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.bodyText: We are essentially doing a write-on-read. Developers are used to treating the get*() APIs as idempotent functions. This will no longer be true. Are you ok if GA counts these as independent events.
timeline.author: ashwinraghav

replies.bodyText: It seems like we are going to build a variety of products built on top of config that would require this feedback loop to be established. I feel like a filter pattern or a listener pattern is a good candidate to consider here, at the risk of optimizing too early.
replies.author: ashwinraghav

replies.bodyText: Yeah, we're OK with GA counting these as separate events. Implemented the listener pattern.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.message: Move all Personalization code to Remote Config.
Move all Personalization code to Remote Config.

timeline.message: Move BiConsumer to internal/ and change Personalization metadata to object.
More places where Personalization metadata is supposed to be object.

timeline.bodyText: Thinking: the pattern of encapsulating P13n logging behind a listener interface seems nice and clean, but it does require passage of the whole config to the listener, which kinda breaks the law of demeter.
timeline.author: erikeldridge
erikeldridge

timeline.bodyText: Thinking out loud: re licensing, GWT is open source and does something similar https://github.com/gwtproject/gwt/blob/f031aba1e5aff65143005de841a491b42fe1031a/user/super/com/google/gwt/emul/java/util/function/BiConsumer.java

timeline.bodyText: As above, if this is an error case, I'd recommend logging something to help customers debug unexpected behavior.
timeline.author: erikeldridge

timeline.bodyText: Any risk of a listener being added multiple times? Should the underlying collection of listeners be a Set?
timeline.author: erikeldridge

timeline.bodyText: I'd recommend logging something anywhere we suppress an error. Silent failures limit the details customers can provide in support requests.
timeline.author: erikeldridge

replies.bodyText:
Thx
Thinking: getJSONObject throws if the key doesn't exist, which will be true for anyone not using P13n. We could check for the key first w has, but since this code only runs during fetch, I don't think it'll be spammy enough to justify that.
replies.author: erikeldridge

replies.bodyText: Some other thoughts: we follow this getJSONObject pattern for other field above but don't log if there's nothing to get. RC had bug reports of spammy logging when we were logging warnings in the expected case for performance monitoring, so using at least the INFO level seems appropriate. I might even use DEBUG here to make it easier to hide this log message for users not using p13n.
replies.author: danasilver

replies.bodyText: In general, if there's an error and it's actionable, I think we'd be wise to log a warning. In this case, it sounds like the common case will be to throw, so it's borderline not an error, and only actionable for folks using the feature, so it should not be WARN level. I guess in this case, we can't differentiate between an error case of missing metadata and the common case of not using the feature. DEBUG probably makes sense since it's a suppressed error, which folks would be looking for when debugging.
replies.author: erikeldridge

timeline.bodyText: Thinking: I like this enforcement of the listener being called on a separate thread, since this is running in the low-latency get layer. I am wary of customers spawning threads unwittingly while calling get, but I think we can optimize if/when it becomes an issue.
timeline.author: erikeldridge
erikeldridge

replies.bodyText: That works too. I figured we're already calling getConfigsFromCache() in getStringFromCache(), so it was easier to just return it, but I guess it is ugly.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.bodyText: Thinking: customers can also get params via getAll ( https://firebase.google.com/docs/reference/android/com/google/firebase/remoteconfig/FirebaseRemoteConfig#getAll() ), which won't log. It feels relatively straightforward to say that's an unsupported advanced use-case, but it is an inconsistency.
timeline.author: erikeldridge

replies.bodyText: getAll() relies on getValue(), which does log, so this case is supported.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.message: Remove ConfigAndValue and instead call getConfigsFromCache() again.
Remove ConfigAndValue and instead call getConfigsFromCache() again.
Only pass value and Personalization metadata to listeners.

timeline.bodyText: Is this used anymore?
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText: What do you think of calling this getPersonalizationMetadata since it's used statically without the Personalization class as context?
timeline.author: danasilver

replies.bodyText: Prefixed them with Personalization. so there's context.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.bodyText: Wonder if there's a more precise word than retrieved here? I think it refers to the value being retrieved by the developer via a get() call, right?
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.message: Use Personalization.getMetadata() to clarify that they're Personalization calls.
Go back to passing the whole config to listeners.

timeline.bodyText: It's not blocking but might be worth thinking about long-term: why is json passed here? it does not look type-safe, given that there are multiple checks for certain keys that are expected to be in this json object. Would it make sense to create a more type-safe interface to the config?
timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: Good point. Switched it to use ConfigContainer instead.
replies.author: vic-flair

timeline.message: Pass ConfigContainer instead of JSONObject to logArmActive().

timeline.bodyText: Maybe "{@link ConfigContainer} containing personalization metadata for {@code key}"
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText: The ConfigContainer is a local cache of the config, but I'm not sure it makes sense to call it a cache in this context. Maybe {@link ConfigContainer} containing {@code key}
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText:
Adding some more description would be helpful for future users. Maybe like
Calls all listeners added to {@link #listeners} with the retrieved key from a {@code get*} call and the config containing the key.
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText: Similar to the other comments maybe add a detail about what it's called on (key and container with the key)
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText: no longer JSON
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText: Is it accurate to say "called when a Personalization parameter value (an arm) is retrieved"? That might help put it in the context of Remote Config a bit more. Would also help to add what the "it" is that's being logged
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.bodyText: What do you think about a test that listeners are called correctly?
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.message: Edit comments and add unit test for FirebaseRemoteConfig integration.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should go with the FirebaseRemoteConfig tests since it's testing the functionality of the get methods? Then the class wouldn't need @VisibleForTesting.
timeline.author: danasilver

timeline.message: Move Personalization integration test to FirebaseRemoteConfigTest.java.

timeline.bodyText: Do we need a different instance of RC for personalization? Using the default namespace will get the same RC instance as frc above.
timeline.author: danasilver
